summary: The LPOE Modernization Trust Fund Act establishes a trust fund in the Treasury for modernizing Land Ports of Entry (LPOE). It outlines funding sources, including fees from customs, immigration, and visa processing, as well as investment of fund assets. The Secretary of Homeland Security, in consultation with other agencies and stakeholders, will use the fund for new port construction, infrastructure improvements, technology procurement, repairs, and hiring personnel. An oversight board will advise on prioritization and review fund expenditures. The bill also includes provisions for surcharges on certain fees and defines key terms.
